snippet: Autopsies of women who died at a government sterilization camp suggest that “spurious medicines” were to blame, not unsanitary conditions or rushed surgery, a medical official said.
abstract: Post-mortem examinations of several women who died after surgery at a government sterilization camp in central India suggest that tainted medications may be to blame, rather than unsanitary conditions or hasty surgeries; Dr R K Gupta, who performed majority of tubal ligation operations, was arrested on charges of culpable homicide.

byline.original: By SUHASINI RAJ and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Suhasini Raj reported from New Delhi, and Ellen Barry from Amsena, India.

lead_paragraph: Autopsies of women who died at a government sterilization camp suggest that “spurious medicines” were to blame, not unsanitary conditions or rushed surgery, a medical official said.

headline.main: Post-Mortems of Victims Point to Tainted Medication in India Sterilization Deaths
headline.print_headline: Post-Mortems of Victims Point to Tainted Medication in India Sterilization Deaths
